com.teamten.image
Class ImageUtils

java.lang.Object
  com.teamten.image.ImageUtils

public class ImageUtils
extends Object

Assorted utility methods for transforming images.

public static BufferedImage makeTransparent(int width,
                                            int height)
Create a new image of the given size with all pixels transparent.

make

public static BufferedImage make(int width,
                                 int height,
                                 Color color)
Create a new image of the given size with a given background color.

makeWhite

public static BufferedImage makeWhite(int width,
                                      int height)
Create a new image of the given size with a white background.

makeLinearGradient

public static BufferedImage makeLinearGradient(int width,
                                               int height,
                                               int beginX,
                                               int beginY,
                                               Color beginColor,
                                               int endX,
                                               int endY,
                                               Color endColor)
Creates an image of the specified size with a linear gradient going from begin to end, interpolating the specified colors linearly. Pixels past the end of the line are the color of that end.

makeCircularGradient

public static BufferedImage makeCircularGradient(int width,
                                                 int height,
                                                 int centerX,
                                                 int centerY,
                                                 Color centerColor,
                                                 int edgeX,
                                                 int edgeY,
                                                 Color edgeColor)
Creates an image of the specified size with a circular gradient going from center to the edge (of the circle), interpolating the specified colors linearly. Pixels past the edge of the circle are the color of the edge.

createGraphics

public static Graphics2D createGraphics(BufferedImage image)
Creates a high-quality graphics objects for this object.

convertType

public static BufferedImage convertType(BufferedImage src,
                                        int newType)
Return the image with a new type.

copy

public static BufferedImage copy(BufferedImage image)
Make a copy of the image.

compose

public static BufferedImage compose(BufferedImage... layers)
Compose images over one another. The first layer in the array is the lowest one.

makeShadow

public static BufferedImage makeShadow(BufferedImage image,
                                       double radius,
                                       double darkness)
Returns the shadow of the input image. The shadow is based only on the alpha channel.

Parameters:
radius - the size of the shadow, in pixels.
darkness - how dark to make the shadow, where 0.0 means none and 1.0 is the darkest.

addReflection

public static BufferedImage addReflection(BufferedImage image,
                                          double reflectionHeightFraction)
Return an image with the original and its reflection.

Parameters:
reflectionHeightFraction - the fraction of the original height to make visible in the reflection. 0.2 is a good value here.

blur

public static BufferedImage blur(BufferedImage image,
                                 double radius)
Blurs an image using a high-quality high-speed two-pass algorithm. Good stuff about blurring: http://www.jhlabs.com/ip/blurring.html

flipVertically

public static BufferedImage flipVertically(BufferedImage image)
Returns a copy of the image, flipped vertically.

flipHorizontally

public static BufferedImage flipHorizontally(BufferedImage image)
Returns a copy of the image, flipped horizontally.

addMargin

public static BufferedImage addMargin(BufferedImage src,
                                      int top,
                                      int right,
                                      int bottom,
                                      int left,
                                      Color color)
Adds a margin to the image. The margin will be of the specified color, unless the color, unless the color is null, in which case the margin will be transparent.

resize

public static BufferedImage resize(BufferedImage image,
                                   int width,
                                   int height)
Returns a resized image.

scale

public static BufferedImage scale(BufferedImage image,
                                  double ratio)
Returns an image scaled by a particular ratio, where 0.5 means half width and half height.

resizeToFit

public static BufferedImage resizeToFit(BufferedImage image,
                                        int width,
                                        int height)
Returns the image resized to fit in this size but keep the original aspect ratio. Use 0 as either size (but not both) to mean "infinity".

getTrimmingRectangle

public static Rectangle getTrimmingRectangle(BufferedImage image)
Return the rectangle representing the part of the image that's not like the frame (specifically, not like the upper-left corner).

Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if the entire image is the same color.

trim

public static BufferedImage trim(BufferedImage image)
Removes any constant color around an image. The color is determined by the upper-left pixel. Returns the sub-image, which shares the raster data with the input image.

Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if the entire image is a single color.

left

public static BufferedImage left(BufferedImage src,
                                 int pixels)
Returns the left part of an image.

right

public static BufferedImage right(BufferedImage src,
                                  int pixels)
Returns the right part of an image.

top

public static BufferedImage top(BufferedImage src,
                                int pixels)
Returns the top part of an image.

bottom

public static BufferedImage bottom(BufferedImage src,
                                   int pixels)
Returns the bottom part of an image.

leftToRight

public static BufferedImage leftToRight(BufferedImage... layers)
Concatenates the images left to right. Images are top-aligned, and the background is initialized to black.

topToBottom

public static BufferedImage topToBottom(BufferedImage... layers)
Concatenates the images top to bottom. Images are left-aligned, and the background is initialized to black.

pasteAt

public static BufferedImage pasteAt(BufferedImage bottom,
                                    BufferedImage top,
                                    int x,
                                    int y)
Returns an image with the top image pasted onto the bottom image at the specified location.

pasteAtWith

public static BufferedImage pasteAtWith(BufferedImage bottom,
                                        BufferedImage top,
                                        int x,
                                        int y,
                                        BlendingMode blendingMode)
Returns an image with the top image pasted onto the bottom image at the specified location and with the specified blending mode.

clipToMask

public static BufferedImage clipToMask(BufferedImage image,
                                       BufferedImage mask)
Returns an image with the color of the main image (which must be BGR) and the alpha of the mask (which must be ABGR, color is ignored). The two images must be the same size.

grayToTransparent

public static BufferedImage grayToTransparent(BufferedImage image,
                                              int grayTransparent,
                                              int grayOpaque)
Returns an semi-transparent image where the transparency was deduced from the color.

interpolateColor

public static Color interpolateColor(Color c1,
                                     Color c2,
                                     double fraction)
Returns an interpolated color, where 0.0 means c1 and 1.0 means c2. Values outside the range 0.0 to 1.1 are valid and will be clamped at 0 and 255 (possibly causing distortion).

makeCheckerboard

public static BufferedImage makeCheckerboard(int width,
                                             int height,
                                             Color color1,
                                             Color color2,
                                             int squareSize)
Generate a checkerboard image. The squares are anchored at the upper-left corner of the image.

Parameters:
width - the width of the generated image
height - the height of the generated image
color1 - the color of the square in the upper-left corner
color2 - the alternating color
squareSize - the width and height of the checker square

composeOverCheckerboard

public static BufferedImage composeOverCheckerboard(BufferedImage image)
Compose the given image over a checkerboard to look for the transparency area.

                          throws IOException
Load an image from a filename.

Throws:
IOException

                        OutputStream outputStream,
                        String mimeType)
                 throws IOException

Throws:
IOException

saveAnimatedGif

public static void saveAnimatedGif(List<BufferedImage> images,
                                   String filename,
                                   int frameTimeMs,
                                   boolean loop)
                            throws IOException
Saves a list of images as an animated GIF with the specified pause time for each image and whether to loop continuously. The filename must end with ".gif". Based on code from http://elliot.kroo.net/software/java/GifSequenceWriter/

Throws:
IOException

getHighQualityRenderingHints

public static RenderingHints getHighQualityRenderingHints()
Returns an object setting as many things to high-quality as possible.

getHighQualityRenderingMap

public static Map<RenderingHints.Key,Object> getHighQualityRenderingMap()
Returns a map setting as many things to high-quality as possible.

getFont

                           boolean bold,
                           boolean italic,
                           boolean narrow,
                           double size)
                    throws FontFormatException,
                           IOException
Return a font of the specified typeface and attributes and size.

Throws:
FontFormatException
IOException
